p: Therefore, this study was undertaken to explore the anxiolytics and antidepressant-like effects of acute and repetitive treatment with Piper nigrum essential oil (PNEO) using open field test (OFT), elevated plus maze (EPM) and tail suspension test (TST) in mice. Furthermore, the possible mechanism(s) of action participated in the anxiolytics and antidepressant-like effects of acute treatment with PNEO in EPM and TST along with neurochemical study was investigated. To evaluate the long term effect of the PNEO, periodic changes in body weight and biochemical parameters were also monitored.
